. Bellevue has a population of 350,000 and is voted 5th best place to live in the

value: connects Bellevue to Seattle, via the Evergreen Point floating bridge on Lake Washington. Prone to traffic jams.  This bridge will be tolled from 5AM to 11PM starting Spring of 2011 using the GoodToGo! pass or by licence plate and Pay By Mail.
provides another route from Seattle across Lake Washington, traversing Mercer Island. It continues eastward to Spokane, and ultimately, Boston.
runs North-South right through the middle of Bellevue, leading north to Kirkland (and eventually rejoining
on the way to Bellingham and ultimately the Canadian border)  To the south,
leads to Renton and the Southcenter shopping district before rejoining
(continuing southbound to Portland, OR, and ultimately the Mexican border).

Almost every bus that runs through Bellevue stops at the Bellevue Transit Center located on 6th Street between 108th Ave NE & 110th Ave NE. Bike lockers are available for rental during regular business hours.

value: runs frequently between Downtown Seattle and Downtown Bellevue.
runs every half hour between SeaTac Airport and Downtown Bellevue.

Express Bus fare is $2.50 per trip, and the drivers will not provide change.
The Puget Sound (which includes Bellevue) has a decent bus transportation network if you're staying in the city.

value: offers both local bus service (good for short distances) and express bus service (good for longer distances).

The two systems do not accept paper transfers from each other.  Use of the prepaid ORCA fare card

does allow interservice transfers.

For trips outside of the core city, you'll probably want a car.
There are a few museums in Bellevue:

value: content=Art museum with fine craft and design exhibitions
content=Is a must see especially the Garden d'Lights in the winter
directions=From I-90: Take Exit 13 and drive south on Lakemont Blvd SE for 3.1 miles. Look for the entrance to the Red Town Trailhead on the left side of the road.

content=Cougar Mountain Regional Wildland Park (CMRWP) is a 3000+ acre park with 36 miles of hiking trails (12 miles suitable for equestrian use).  It showcases a variety of natural features from forests and waterfalls to meadows and cliffs.  There are four primary trailheads, each offering a different experience.

, a large shopping mall complex in the heart of Downtown Bellevue.

value: This old favorite restaurant closed in
, but is now open in the Factoria area of Bellevue, almost at the intersection of I-405 and I-90, across Lake Washington.

, 15600 NE 8th St # 9, Crossroads Mall (425) 649-0355. Udupi serves authentic thali plates, dosas, and pani puri, not available in Seattle. Their daily lunch buffet is a soul food hit with many South Indian Microsoft employees. [Closed as of 12/1/2010]
, downtown Bellevue for great pinot noir and Italian fare.
content=Serves excellent breakfasts & deli sandwiches, wide assortment of bagel choices, and great coffee.
hours=Lunch: Monday - Friday: 11:30AM-2:30PM Dinner: Sunday - Thursday: 5PM-10PM Friday - Saturday: 5PM-11PM

content=Located on the 21st floor of the Bank of America Building, with spectacular views of the Cascade Mountains and Lake Washington available from every table. Serves traditional steak & seafood dishes, exclusively uses USDA Prime Beef.
directions=From I-405, take exit 13b west onto NE 8th. Turn right on Bellevue Way: the restaurant is in a strip-mall immediately on the left.
content=Very good Taiwanese food: including many popular street foods.
content=Award-winning restaurant originating in Taiwan, specializing in xiaolongbao (soup dumplings) and other Asian fares. $15-30.
content=Closest hotel to the Meydenbauer Convention Center. Within walking distance from the Bellevue Arts Museum and Bellevue Downtown Park.
content=Located just off the 520 freeway. Within the heart of the Microsoft Main Campus.
content=The 382-room hotel offers views of the Olympic and Cascade mountain ranges and is a part of the Bellevue Collection, a major regional shopping destination.
content=Rooms have FeatherBorne Beds and full kitchens. Laundry facility, fitness room, grocery shopping.
